As Scorponok converses with Night Shift, Tucson plays the part and continue=
s to act as if he's off line. He was anxious to hear how his plan would pla=
y out. He keeps himself quiet all the while.

Night Shift uses Scorponok's =
body for support and gets himself back on his feet. 

"Believe me Scorponok=
 that miserable punk aft Autobot didn't make it easy for me.  As you can se=
e.  But I think I showed 'em ample enough that ya don't mess with a Decepti=
con.  Now, if you can help me get these arrows outa my joints, I can change=
 inta somethn' that moves a lot faster.  They're stoppn' me from transformn=
'. Slag for a blind bot he's got good aim."

He then narrows his eyes.

" N=
ow, Hydras, yeah...  I thought I had the matrix covered but it turned out I=
'd been had, big time.  Slaggn' son of a miserable glitch..  Ohh yeah, I'm =
not finished with Pretty boy yet, Scorponok, not by a long shot.  Okay, I'm=
 ready ta go explain myself ta Hydras.  Too bad I ain't got anythn' better =
ta send back ta him."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supe=
rcyclonus@...> wrote:
>

e vicinity of the Ark, but just about a hundred to two hundred feet away. T=
hey didn't get far before they started to battle, yet Nightshift was transm=
itting a message to Hydras. His transmission range is extensive.

Thanks, I appreciate the info :)

> > BIC: Tucson makes for a make shi=
ft, mid transformation sequence, as instructed by Lord Elder.
> >
> > "Sorr=
y about that Sir, I shouldn't have assumed you had the capability. You're r=
ight, this should be convincing enough."

> > Half robot, half SUV, Tucs=
on now falls to the ground, as if going unconcious. Walking further ahead, =
with a slow limp, Night Shift puts a little distance between himself and Tu=
cson before falling painfully to the ground, waiting for help to arrive.
> =

> Lord Elder acknowledged Tuscon's transmission with a single stroke on
> =
the terminal. there was something funny about that dot that
> periodically =
appeared. For the moment it disappeared again, probably
> because it had st=
opped moving again. His computer instruments were
> picking up just barely,=
 it was only the very slightest of distortions.
> 
> He glanced over at Eli=
ta, "Yes" he said distractedly, "A hologram. But
> I don't have one. But ma=
ybe we all could build one later." he said as
> he watched the screen as hi=
s radar began picking up Scorponok's
> approach, "Oh boy, here it goes" he =
mumbled under his breath again.
> 
> **************************************=
*****
> 
> Meanwhile . . .
> 
> Scorponok began his approach, his robot mod=
e clearly visible. Like
> many of the earlier built Decepticons, he had the=
 ability to fly in
> robot mode. Typically he saw no need to use it, but th=
ere were times
> when it was useful, such as now.
> 
> As Nightshift moved =
across the ground, Scorponok moved in his
> direction, his larger frame and=
 massive dimension dwarfing your more
> typical and even most of your large=
r framed mechs.
> 
> With a deft use of boosters he landed on the ground a =
few meters in
> front of Nightshift and looked around. He looked over at Tu=
scon's
> apparently broken form in the distance. "Interesting." he said as =
he
> turned his gaze on the approaching Nightshift. "Tuscon fell much
> eas=
ier to you than he did to the others." Scorponok said thoughtfully,
> conve=
niently obscuring the fact that he was there too.
> 
> "Hydras wants to see=
 you." he said, his voice deep and somewhat firm,
> holding out a large cla=
wed hand to steady Nightshift should he need
> it.
>
